授業目的: The course will give students the opportunity to learn about a field of research, industrial relations, which is not very prominent in Japan, in order to make them aware of the importance of IR in particular in foreign countries. Therefore the course will provide students with an in depth introduction into the research area of industrial and work relations. Its intention is to make students familiar with various types of industrial relation traditions and systems and make them aware of the importance of IR for successful company management.
到達目標:
Students are supposed to acquire a broad knowledge about different types and regulation with regard to IR in various countries. The goal is to make students realize that IR in Europe in particular, but also in the USA and increasingly in developing countries too are a decisive factor for company success or failure.
Evaluation of students' performance will be based on: 60% participation and contribution to the course and 40% final student presentation.
授業方法:
This class will be conducted face-to-face. Depending on faculty regulations, applications for online participation might be accepted.
PPP presentation and class discussion; the course's conception follows a seminar approach
